noun.description: A member of a people having no permanent abode, and who travel from place to place to find fresh pasture for their livestock.
examples: the withering of their grasslands forced the nomads of the Sahara to descend into the Nile valley
the nomads who roam the borderlands of Afghanistan
the Magyars were a nomad people of the steppes

origin: Late 16th century: from French nomade, via Latin from Greek nomas, nomad- roaming in search of pasture, from the base of nemein to pasture.
